segment.source: Issues Window
segment.target: Issues Window

segment.source: Issues Window
segment.target: Issues Window

segment.source: Issues Window
segment.target: Issues Window

segment.source: Use the Issues window to view issues identified by running an assessment from the Assessment Platform.
segment.target: Use the Issues window to view issues identified by running an assessment from the Assessment Platform.

segment.source: If the recording was not created with the Assessment Platform, the recording lacks data about issues, and therefore the Issues window is minimized.
segment.target: If the recording was not created with the Assessment Platform, the recording lacks data about issues, and therefore the Issues window is minimized.

segment.source: Using the Issues Window
segment.target: Using the Issues Window

segment.source: When you click an issue in the Issues window, the Details window shows details of that issue, with recommended solutions.
segment.target: When you click an issue in the Issues window, the Details window shows details of that issue, with recommended solutions.

segment.source: To see a summary report of all of the issues that need investigation, see the Issue Details section at the bottom of the Analysis tab.
segment.target: To see a summary report of all of the issues that need investigation, see the Issue Details section at the bottom of the Analysis tab.

segment.source: You can detach this window and drag it anywhere on your desktop, or resize or close it.
segment.target: You can detach this window and drag it anywhere on your desktop, or resize or close it.

segment.source: To dock it, drag it to any of the docking points at the top, bottom, right, or left sides of the UI until the area is highlighted.
segment.target: To dock it, drag it to any of the docking points at the top, bottom, right, or left sides of the UI until the area is highlighted.

segment.source: Then, release the cursor.Within the Analysis tab, you can maximize the Issue Details window to be able to view it in a larger size.
segment.target: Then, release the cursor.Within the Analysis tab, you can maximize the Issue Details window to be able to view it in a larger size.

segment.source: If this window is not open, click Issues on the Window menu.
segment.target: If this window is not open, click Issues on the Window menu.

segment.source: Using the Search options in the Issues Window
segment.target: Using the Search options in the Issues Window

segment.source: You can use the search bar at the top of this window to look for specific issues based on several criteria determined by the assessment generating the Issues:
segment.target: You can use the search bar at the top of this window to look for specific issues based on several criteria determined by the assessment generating the Issues:

segment.source: Free-text search: Type in the text box to see the list of relevant issues
segment.target: Free-text search: Type in the text box to see the list of relevant issues

segment.source: Multiple filter options: Add multiple filters to shorten the issue list to your defined criteria.
segment.target: Multiple filter options: Add multiple filters to shorten the issue list to your defined criteria.

segment.source: For example, you can filter by “Manufacturer equals” for a list of Issues by a particular manufacturer.
segment.target: For example, you can filter by “Manufacturer equals” for a list of Issues by a particular manufacturer.

segment.source: The text area will auto-complete with the available options once you begin typing.
segment.target: The text area will auto-complete with the available options once you begin typing.

segment.source: Other operators such as “not equals”, and “contains” are also available in these options.
segment.target: Other operators such as “not equals”, and “contains” are also available in these options.

segment.source: If this window is not open, click Issues on the Window menu.
segment.target: If this window is not open, click Issues on the Window menu.
